intro: Eriocephalus scariosissimus, commonly known as the silver leaf dandelion, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It produces a composite flower head that consists of many small florets, typical of the dandelion genus. Eriocephalus scariosissimus is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
